title: Twitter accused of bullying anti-hate campaigners
description: A social media monitoring group says legal threats sent by X Corp are an attempt to "silence criticism".

title: Gallium and germanium: What China’s new move in microchip war means for world
description: The world's second largest economy is putting controls on gallium and germanium exports.

title: Fabinho: Liverpool midfielder joins Saudi side Al-Ittihad
description: Brazil midfielder Fabinho completes a move to Saudi Arabian club Al-Ittihad from Liverpool on a three-year deal.

title: Unesco recommends adding Venice to endangered list
description: Italian authorities are failing to protect the city from over tourism and climate change, Unesco says.

title: Awaab Ishak: Rochdale landlord boss says lessons learned
description: A housing association chairman is confident mistakes will not be repeated after Awaab Ishak's death.

title: The Ashes 2023: Stuart Broad bowls England to win over Australia
description: Stuart Broad ends his glittering career by bowling England to another dramatic victory in the fifth Test against Australia to leave a memorable Ashes series level at 2-2.

title: The Ashes 2023: Stuart Broad says he will retire with 'pure joy and happiness' after fairytale finish
description: Stuart Broad says he will leave cricket with "pure joy and happiness" after taking the final two wickets as England drew the Ashes with a 49-run victory.

title: Ukraine war: Russian strike on Zelensky's home city kills six
description: At least six people, including a 10-year-old girl, die in the Ukrainian president's home city of Kryvyi Rih.

title: The Ashes 2023: Australia fell short of their goal with series draw, says captain Pat Cummins
description: Australia captain Pat Cummins says his side "fell a little short of the goal" despite being proud of his players for retaining the Ashes.

title: Netball World Cup 2023: England beat Tonga 72-46 in second pool phase
description: England come through a physical test to beat Tonga 72-46 and start the second pool phase of the Netball World Cup with an improved display.

title: Paul Reubens: Pee-wee Herman actor dies age 70
description: Paul Reubens, who portrayed the children's TV and film character, had privately been fighting cancer.

title: UK weather: When will it stop raining and the summer improve?
description: Some drier weather is expected eventually - but it won't be anytime too soon.

title: Teacher strikes in England end as all four unions accept pay deal
description: The 6.5% pay rise will increase the average teacher's salary by £2,500, one union says.

title: The Ashes 2023: England win after fairytale Stuart Broad ending
description: England win an incredible fifth Test by 49 runs to level the Ashes series at 2-2 as Stuart Broad takes the final two wickets in a fairytale ending to his cricket career at The Oval.

title: The Ashes: Stuart Broad switches bails again before removing Todd Murphy
description: Stuart Broad switches the bails at the bowler's end and immediately has Todd Murphy caught behind on a thrilling day five of the fifth Ashes Test at The Oval.

title: Hangzhou Zoo: Our sun bears are real, not humans in disguise
description: Hangzhou Zoo denies its sun bears are people, after a video of one standing like a human went viral.

title: Women's World Cup: England without Walsh still 'strong enough', says Wiegman
description: Sarina Wiegman says England are "strong enough" to navigate their way through the Women's World Cup despite losing midfielder Keira Walsh.

title: Dartmoor wild camping to resume after appeal win
description: Park Authority win battle against landowners to allow wild camping in Dartmoor without permission.

title: Man bought private jet with borrowed council money
description: Leaked documents show businessman went on a spending spree and left a council effectively bankrupt.

title: Pakistan explosion: Eyewitness describes doomsday scenes
description: The death toll is expected to rise as police look at the possibility of a suicide attack.

title: Pop Works: Eight taken to hospital after pepper spray released in club, police say
description: Police are investigating who discharged the noxious substance in a Doncaster venue.

title: Plane crashes into sea by busy New Hampshire beach
description: A small plane was left floating upside down in the water after an emergency landing caused it to flip.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban burn ‘immoral’ musical instruments
description: The founder of Afghanistan’s National Institute of Music likened the move to "cultural genocide".

title: Dart Charge: Drivers struggling to pay for Dartford Crossing
description: National Highways says its payment website is experiencing high demand after an update.

title: 2023 Women's World Cup permutations: Who needs what in Australia and New Zealand
description: The group stages of the 2023 Fifa Women's World Cup are approaching the sharp end - and there is still plenty to be decided. Here's what each team needs in order to qualify.

title: Rishi Sunak taking first family holiday in four years, No 10 says
description: The prime minister's last attempt at a foreign break was cut short by the death of the late Queen.

title: What is an oil and gas licence?
description: The government is offering energy firms North Sea permits but what do they allow them to do?

title: Rishi Sunak defends granting new North Sea oil and gas licences
description: The prime minister says the decision is "entirely consistent" with the UK's net zero commitments.

title: Savings: Banks with lowest rates will face action, watchdog warns
description: The UK's financial regulator says it will take "robust action" if banks offer unjustifiably low rates.

title: Niger coup: Ousted President Mohamed Bazoum meets Chad's leader
description: Mohamed Bazoum meets Chad's president, as Niger's junta says France is planning military intervention.

title: Andrew Malkinson: Living costs for wrongfully convicted unfair - PM
description: It emerged wrongly convicted Andrew Malkinson may have costs deducted for his time in jail.

title: Just Stop Oil trio deny Lord's Ashes Test trespass
description: The three activists ran on to the pitch during the second Ashes Test match of the summer.

title: Red kite awareness campaign after reports of stolen food
description: Wallingford Town Council launches a poster campaign after reports of the birds stealing food.

title: Jim Parker: Midsomer Murders composer dies aged 88
description: The composer was behind the music for programmes such as House of Cards and Foyle's War.

title: Harry Potter: Fans celebrate wizard's birthday
description: Superfans are spending the day watching their favourite movies and dressing up.

title: Ukraine's Motherland monument gets a makeover
description: The BBC's James Waterhouse watches on as work to remove a huge Soviet-era symbol begins in Kyiv.

title: British husband who killed dying wife in Cyprus released
description: David Hunter "can't describe" how freedom feels after killing wife Janice in an assisted suicide.

title: Royal Marines veteran Fred Ames celebrates 100th birthday
description: Fred Ames, who fought in the Battle of Anzio in Italy, describes himself as a "survivor".

title: Renewables, nuclear and fossil fuels: The UK's changing energy mix
description: To meet climate change targets, more of the UK's energy needs to come from low-carbon sources.

title: Belfast drug users warned over possible bad batch of 'benzos'
description: Overdoses among people taking 'benzos' are understood to have increased.

title: At least 45 killed in Pakistan after explosion at Islamist political rally
description: The attack on a rally organised by an Islamist party comes ahead of elections due later this year.

title: China floods: Man rescued from overturned car
description: The rescue was shown on Chinese state TV as devastating floods hit Hebei province.

title: Women's World Cup 2023: Hinata Miyazawa's superb finish gives Japan lead against Spain
description: Japan's Hinata Miyazawa races clear and fires her side into the lead in the 12th minute in their Group C decider against Spain at the Women's World Cup.

title: What is carbon capture and how does it fight climate change?
description: Capturing the warming gas CO2 and storing it under the North Sea is an important part of the UK's energy strategy

title: Cardi B throws microphone into crowd at gig after being hit by drink
description: The rapper was reacting to having a drink hit her on stage while she was performing.

title: Carer shortage: Woman stuck in hospital for 11 months
description: The 96-year-old was one of thousands on waiting lists for carers and says she felt "imprisoned".

title: Scientists buzzing with hopes for AI bee research
description: Scientists hope a computer system will learn to automatically identify bee species from buzzes picked up by autonomous recording stations

title: Ukraine war: 'People call us the Ghosts of Bakhmut'
description: The BBC is given exclusive access to a team of elite Ukrainian snipers on night raids near Bakhmut.

title: Australia army helicopter crash: No hope of survivors, minister says
description: Defence minister said significant wreckage found points to a catastrophic incident.

title: Theresa May's ex-adviser to stand in Matt Hancock's seat in next election
description: Nick Timothy resigned as the former PM's joint chief of staff shortly after the 2017 election.

title: Madonna: I feel so lucky to be alive
description: The 64-year-old spent several days in intensive care while receiving treatment for an infection.
